summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) inmate history and assignment report for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, generated on August 10, 2019. It details his custody status, housing assignments, medical/security designations, and attorney visits from his admission on July 6, 2019, up to the report date, including his transfer to a hospital on the morning of his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Bureau of Prisons inmate history and assignment reports, detailing his custody, housing, medical status, and activities from admission on July 6, 2019, to August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Admission to MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was admitted as a pre-sentenced adult inmate to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Court Appearance
events.description: Epstein was taken to court for an appearance with a scheduled return to the MCC.

events.title: Security Threat Designation for Rape
events.description: Epstein was assigned a security threat designation of 'HISTORY OF COMMITTING RAPE'.

events.title: Hospital Transfer and Death
events.description: Epstein was transferred from the MCC to a local hospital via US Marshals escort with a scheduled return. This occurred on the morning of his death by suicide.

locations: New York MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was in custody at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from July 6, 2019, until his death on August 10, 2019.
On the morning of August 10, 2019, Epstein was transferred via US Marshals escort to a local hospital, which corresponds to the day he was found dead in his cell.
The BOP records list Epstein's offenses as 'SEX TRAFFICKING CONSP.' and 'SEX TRAFFICKING OF MINORS'.
On July 10, 2019, Epstein was given a security threat designation of 'HISTORY OF COMMITTING RAPE' within the prison system.
The records show frequent attorney visits from July 7, 2019, through August 9, 2019, indicating active legal preparation during his pre-trial detention.
